name: The Westin Beijing Financial Street

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from a 6 night stay at the Westin. The hotel is new, absolutely beautiful, and has the most helpful, gracious staff we've met in years. Every staff member went out of his or her way to make us feel welcomed. Since my husband is a Platinum Starwood member, we were upgraded to a Renewal Suite and were able to use the club level lounge, which has a great breakfast and happy hour buffet. We had a wonderful stay here. We absolutely recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel, wonderful staff!

reviews.text: A wonderful hotel for business travelers.
reviews.title: A wonderful hotel

reviews.title: Residence rooms are the way to go

likes.liked: — High quality facility - rooms, restaurant, business center (computer access)

reviews.text: The hotel is centrally located in the Financial Street of Beijing, known as the “Wall Street” in China. It will only take 1 minutes walk to get to China’s “Regulatory Commissions” for banking, insurance and securities. This is especially convenient for people like me whose business is finance related. And cabs took 15 minutes to get me to the National theatre which is just next to Tiananmen Square.
reviews.title: Great Accomodations and outstanding service

likes.disliked: — The location could be a bit more central.

reviews.text: And I just noticed some giant finance companies are just located around the hotel, like Citi, GS and JP Morgan. The shortcoming for this is you can not easily get cabs in the rush hours in front of hotel.
reviews.title: Wonderful Westin!

reviews.text: The Westin is within walking distance to a lot of financial institutions and government agencies so if you are visiting them this is the best location. Quite a lot of restaurants along the Financial Street, but you can also find chain stores (Pizza Hut, KFC, Starbucks, Yoshinoya etc) across the street. The room is generous in size and quite comfortable. Breakfast buffet has wide selection of both western and Asian style food. Staff is polite, friendly and willing to help. Staff generally speak English including waitress at the restaurants and bars. Things are expensive though, food, beverages, or services like printing and airport transfer, on par with any other international city. You probably can get much better deal outside of the hotel or the financial district. During my stay there were quite some official receptions (with conference or other activities) and the hotel could be crowded at times. There were also incidents of smoking and mid night yelling (apparently drunk) which the hotel might need to tighten control on.
reviews.title: Well located, excellent service

reviews.text: This is a fantastic hotel in the Financial District of Beijing. My office is situated there and we get the option to choose from a number of different hotels but I always end up choosing the Westin in Beijing because of it's great staff and service (very friendly and attentive), excellent rooms (spacious, comfortable and clean) and of course their wonderful breakfast buffett (massive selection!). They also have a great lobby bar that can become quite busy in the night. I would highly recommend the Westin Beijing to anyone going to Beijing!
reviews.title: Best business hotel in the Financial District of Beijing!

reviews.text: I stayed at the hotel as I was attending a conference at the same location. Being a Starwood member, I find their rooms and service at par with other Starwood hotels. Check-in process was good and managed to secure a room despite arriving at the hotel early in the morning. However, since non-smoking is not available, i settled in the smoking room. Not too bad although the tobacco smell was quite strong initially. Nevertheless, the room was excellent and I particularly enjoyed the bed and plush pillows.
reviews.title: Excellent business hotel...

reviews.text: One of the hotel chef (Raymond) was attentive to my dietary needs and upon seeing me entering the cafe for breakfast, he approached and walked me through the buffet spread to inform me which food is acceptable for muslim and which are not. I truly appreciate his sensitivity and gesture. He even offered to prepare lunch for my colleagues and I during the conference. An exceptional service indeed!
reviews.title: Non Smoking Floors is just a suggestion

reviews.text: The hotel is located within the financial district and a few station away from the tourist area e.g. Tiananmen square, Forbidden city, Silk Market. If you want to experience the Beijing transportation, you can try the subway and the nearest station is situated abt approx. 1 km from the hotel. Getting a taxi is easy via the hotel concierge but I find it difficult to communicate with the taxi drivers since my mandarin is limited to "Ni Hao" and "Xie xie" :) If you need to take a taxi, ask the hotel staff to write down the name of your destination in mandarin and show it to the taxi driver. Don't forget the hotel name card too for your return trip to the hotel.
reviews.title: Best of our Viking tour hotels.

reviews.text: When I checked in, things were good. However, I noticed someone next to me wanting to change local money. Gosh, the reaction from the receptionist was unthinkable. She just brush the guest aside saying that there were too many guests checking in and they were busy.

reviews.text: This morning, after an late (early) night checking out the nightspots, I was soundly asleep when the attendants just knocked and entered my room. Ok, so I forgotten to put the privacy sign on, shouldn't they be a little bit sensitive? Knock and enter! First time anywhere.

reviews.text: I have a lot of sensitive business documents. I didn't really sleep much. So when I left the hotel I made sure I had the privacy sign on. Imagine me coming back with a bed well made up. These people do not care anything about what their customers want.
reviews.title: Good Business Person's Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having embarked on a trip to China with my wife organised by Viking Cruises we arrived at Beijing and were taken by our fantastic Viking courier, 'Jimmy' to the Westin Beijing Hotel. The Hotel did not disappoint, the room was superb and the service excellent. When my wife discovered she had not brought her phone charger a call to the reception resulted in an immediate response and after a couple of tries they found a suitable charger for her , spot on !
reviews.title: What a Fabulous place and service

reviews.text: We also had a meal in the Italian restaurant in the Hotel (a franchise) which was expensive and more especially the food was not very good. We spoke to the trainee manager and explained that the service was very good but the food below standard. That evening there was a knock at the door and the Restaurant Manager came to apologise and gave us a bottle wine.
reviews.title: Real Help

reviews.text: All in all we can say the Hotel and the staff (especially the trainee's from Spain and the USA) were definately 5+ star and would highly recommend .

aka: The Westin Beijing Financial Street Hotel
description: The Westin Beijing, Financial Street is centrally located just minutes from The Forbidden City and Tiananmen Square. The hotel reflect all that Westin has become famous for, including the Westin Heavenly Bed, the Westin Executive Club, the Westin Kids Club, a rainforest shower as well as all the features of a modern luxury hotel. You can unwind in the Westin Heavenly Spa, recharge with a Westin Workout, or enjoy free wireless high speed internet access.
